subject: Relationships
title: The Two Types of Trust
description: One-minute skill: The Two Types of Trust.

hook.text: You trust your surgeon with your life but not with your secrets. Trust isn't one thing â€” it comes in types.

buildup.text: Psychologists distinguish cognitive trust (based on evidence) from emotional trust (based on feeling safe).

discovery.text: Cognitive trust says: 'They're competent and reliable.' Emotional trust says: 'They care about me and won't hurt me.'

twist.text: You can have high cognitive trust and low emotional trust â€” or vice versa. Mismatches cause confusion in relationships.

climax.text: Full trust requires both types. Competence without warmth feels cold. Warmth without competence feels unreliable.

punchline.text: Trust has two layers: competence and care. Full trust needs both.

quiz.question: What are the two types of trust?
